entry.title: Glass Rain
entry.summary:
Author: soaring_bubblegum

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 232,203Chapters: 50/54Kudos: 1,792

Summary: Jason Todd wakes up in the wrong Gotham. Here, he stayed dead. Here, his death broke his family so completely they became the monsters they once fought. Dick Grayson haunts the skyline with wings and talons, Barbara Gordon moves like a spider made of shadow, and something that might have once been Batman rules from a corrupted cave. The city is quarantined, the air tastes of ozone and old blood, and Jason should be running. Instead, he finds himself drawn to the creature that was once his brother—the one stalking him through twisted streets with eyes that still burn with something almost human. Some hunts, it turns out, go both ways.

entry.title: Shot Through the Heart
entry.summary:
Author: SaviouroftheStars

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,633Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 107

Summary: Jason Todd died once. It didn’t stick. Now a revenant with a stuttering heartbeat and a soul that won’t stay buried, he hunts the things that crawl out of the dark. But nothing he’s fought, not demons, not ghosts, not monsters wearing human skin, comes close to the pair now stalking the hunter circuit. They’re carving through veteran hunters like wheat. One is a towering brute in a mask.The other is a beautiful, shackled young man whose presence feels like gravity—quiet, strange, and impossible to ignore. Every instinct Jason has screams danger. Something about him feels ancient, bound, wrong. And yet Jason can’t look away. He’s going to have to kill them both. He just wishes the pretty one wasn’t making the job so damn complicated.
